New York City.passage: New York City is the most populous city in the United States, with an estimated 8,336,817 residents as of 2020, and is the cultural, financial, and media capital of the world. Located in the Northeastern region of the country, New York City is home to the largest subway system in the world, with over 472 miles of track and 472 stations. The city is also home to the world's two largest stock exchanges, the New York Stock Exchange and NASDAQ. New York City is a global hub of international business and commerce, and is home to the headquarters of many of the world's largest corporations, including Goldman Sachs, JPMorgan Chase, Citigroup, and Morgan Stanley. The city is also a major center for media, publishing, and entertainment, with many of the world's largest media conglomerates, including NBCUniversal, CBS Corporation, and Viacom, headquartered in the city. New York City is known for its iconic landmarks, including the Statue of Liberty, the Empire State Building, and Central Park. The city is also home to many world-renowned museums, including the Metropolitan Museum of Art, the Museum of Modern Art, and the American Museum of Natural History. The city is also a major center for the arts, with many theaters and performing arts centers, including the Lincoln Center for the Performing Arts and the Brooklyn Academy of Music. New York City is also known for its diverse and vibrant culture, with a wide range of ethnic neighborhoods and communities, including Chinatown, Little Italy, and Harlem. The city is also home to many world-renowned restaurants, including some of the best pizza and bagels in the world.

Tokyo.passage: Tokyo is the capital city of Japan and the world's most populous metropolis. It is the center of the Greater Tokyo Area, which is the largest metropolitan area in the world. Tokyo is in the Kanto region on the east coast of Honshu, the largest island of Japan. The city is known for its vibrant atmosphere, its bustling streets and its modern technologies. Tokyo was originally a small fishing village named Edo, which in 1603 became the center of a new, powerful government and rapidly grew into a wealthy city. During the Meiji Restoration of 1868, the emperor moved to Tokyo and the city became the capital of Japan. Since then, Tokyo has been the center of Japanese political and economic power. Today, Tokyo is a major global city and a hub for international business and finance. It is also one of the world's most popular tourist destinations, attracting millions of visitors every year. The city is known for its unique blend of modern and traditional culture, its high-tech gadgets and its delicious food. Tokyo is home to many world-famous landmarks, including the Tokyo Tower, the Imperial Palace and the Sensoji Temple. The city is also famous for its vibrant nightlife, its fashion and its entertainment. Tokyo is a city that never sleeps and there is always something new to discover.

Paris.passage: Paris is the capital and most populous city of France, with an area of 105 square kilometres and an official estimated population of 2,148,271 residents as of 2021. The city is a major global city, and a center of art, fashion, gastronomy, and culture. Its influence in politics, education, entertainment, media, fashion, science, and the arts all contribute to its status as one of the world's major global cities. Paris is home to many iconic landmarks, including the Eiffel Tower, the Louvre Museum, Notre-Dame Cathedral, the Arc de Triomphe, and the Palace of Versailles. The city is also known for its romantic atmosphere, with its cafes, restaurants, and street vendors adding to its charm. Paris is divided into 20 arrondissements, or districts, which are numbered from 1 to 20 in a clockwise spiral from the center of the city, which is located on the Île de la Cité. Each arrondissement has its own unique character and attractions, from the trendy boutiques and cafes of the Marais to the bohemian vibe of Montmartre. The city is also known for its high-end fashion, with many of the world's top designers and fashion houses based in Paris. The city is home to the famous fashion week, which takes place twice a year and attracts fashion enthusiasts from around the world. Paris is also a major center for art and culture, with many museums, galleries, and theaters throughout the city.

London.passage: London is the capital and largest city of England and the United Kingdom. Standing on the River Thames in the south-east of England, at the head of its 50-mile (80 km) estuary leading to the North Sea, London has been a major settlement for two millennia. Londinium was founded by the Romans. The City of London, London's ancient core − an area of just 1.12 square miles (2.9 km2) and colloquially known as the Square Mile − retains its medieval boundaries. The City of Westminster is an area of London to the west of the City of London and was historically the site of the Palace of Westminster, the seat of the British government. London is a leading global city, with strengths in the arts, commerce, education, entertainment, fashion, finance, healthcare, media, professional services, research and development, tourism, and transport all contributing to its prominence. It is one of the world's leading financial centres and has the fifth-or sixth-largest metropolitan area GDP in the world depending on the measurement method. London is a world cultural capital. It is the world's most-visited city as measured by international arrivals and has the world's largest city airport system measured by passenger traffic. London's 43 universities form the largest concentration of higher education institutions in Europe. In 2012, London became the first city to host the modern Summer Olympic Games three times. London has a diverse range of peoples and cultures, and more than 300 languages are spoken within its boundaries. It is a major centre for music, film, art, theatre, dance, and television.

Los Angeles.passage: Los Angeles (/lɔːs ˈændʒələs/ (listen); Spanish: Los Ángeles), officially the City of Los Angeles and often known by its initials L.A., is the second-most populous city in the United States, after New York City, and the largest and most populous city in the state of California. It is located in Southern California, on a coastal plain overlooking the Pacific Ocean. The city is the focal point of the larger Los Angeles metropolitan area, which is the third-largest metropolitan area in the United States, with a population of nearly 14 million people. Los Angeles is known for its Mediterranean climate, ethnic diversity, sprawling metropolis, and as a major center of the American entertainment industry, particularly in film, television, and music. The city is home to renowned institutions covering a broad range of professional and cultural fields, and is one of the most substantial economic engines within the United States. Los Angeles has been ranked as one of the world's most livable cities and is considered a global city, with strengths in business, entertainment, culture, media, fashion, science, sports, technology, education, and tourism. The city is divided into many neighborhoods and enclaves, each with its unique character and history. Some of the most well-known neighborhoods include Hollywood, Beverly Hills, Santa Monica, Venice, and Downtown Los Angeles. Los Angeles is also home to a number of significant cultural landmarks, such as the Getty Center, the Los Angeles County Museum of Art, and the Griffith Observatory. Additionally, the city is home to a number of professional sports teams, including the Los Angeles Dodgers, Los Angeles Lakers, Los Angeles Clippers, and the Los Angeles Kings.

Shanghai.passage: Shanghai is one of the four direct-controlled municipalities of the People's Republic of China, located on the eastern coast of China, at the mouth of the Yangtze River. It is the largest city in China by population, with more than 24 million people, and is a global financial center and transport hub. Shanghai has a rich history, dating back to the 12th century when it was a small fishing village. It grew in importance in the 19th century due to its port, which was opened to foreign trade by the Treaty of Nanking in 1842. The city then became a center of commerce, and was known as the "Paris of the East" due to its Western-style architecture and culture. In the early 20th century, Shanghai became a haven for refugees fleeing war and persecution, particularly Jews fleeing Nazi Germany. It also became a center of Communist activity, and was the site of the First National Congress of the Communist Party of China in 1921. During World War II, Shanghai was occupied by Japan and became a battleground between Chinese and Japanese forces. After the war, the city was returned to Chinese control and became a major center of industry and commerce. Today, Shanghai is a global financial center, with the Shanghai Stock Exchange and the headquarters of many multinational corporations located in the city. It is also a major transport hub, with two international airports and the world's longest sea-crossing bridge, the Donghai Bridge. Shanghai is known for its unique blend of Western and Chinese culture, and is home to many historic landmarks, such as the Bund and Yu Garden.

Mumbai.passage: Mumbai, formerly known as Bombay, is the capital city of the Indian state of Maharashtra. It is the most populous city in India, with an estimated population of 20 million people as of 2021. Mumbai is located on the west coast of India and has a deep natural harbor. The city is also known as the "City of Dreams" due to its role in the Indian film industry, which is based in Mumbai. Mumbai is a major financial and commercial hub of India and is home to the Bombay Stock Exchange, the National Stock Exchange of India, and the Reserve Bank of India. The city is also a center for the entertainment industry, with many Bollywood film studios located in the city. Mumbai has a rich history, dating back to the 3rd century BC when it was under the rule of the Maurya Empire. The city was later ruled by the Gupta Empire, the Arabs, and the Portuguese. In the 17th century, the British East India Company established a trading post in Mumbai, which eventually grew into a major city. Today, Mumbai is a bustling metropolis with a diverse population and a rich cultural heritage. The city is known for its vibrant street life, colorful markets, and delicious street food. It is also home to many historic landmarks, including the Gateway of India, the Chhatrapati Shivaji Terminus, and the Elephanta Caves. Despite its economic success, Mumbai faces many challenges, including poverty, crime, and traffic congestion. The city is also vulnerable to natural disasters, such as floods and earthquakes.

Beijing.passage: Beijing is the capital of the People's Republic of China and the world's third most populous city proper. It is located in northern China, and is governed as a direct-controlled municipality under the national government, with 16 urban and suburban districts and two rural counties. Beijing is an ancient city with a long history, dating back more than 3,000 years. As the last of the Four Great Ancient Capitals of China, Beijing has been the political center of the country for much of the past eight centuries. The city is renowned for its rich history, culture, and heritage. It is also known for its modern infrastructure and as a major transportation hub, with dozens of airports, high-speed railways, and expressways. Beijing is home to many famous landmarks, such as the Forbidden City, the Temple of Heaven, the Summer Palace, and the Great Wall of China. The city is also known for its traditional siheyuan housing, hutongs, and courtyard houses. The city's culture is also reflected in its food, including Peking duck, hot pot, and a variety of noodle and dumpling dishes. Beijing is a major center for politics, economy, culture, and education in China. It is home to several world-renowned universities, such as Peking University and Tsinghua University. The city is also home to the headquarters of most of China's largest state-owned enterprises, and is an important hub for the national economy. Beijing hosted the 2008 Summer Olympics and was chosen to host the 2022 Winter Olympics, making it the first city to ever host both winter and summer Olympics.

Istanbul.passage: Istanbul is the largest city in Turkey, located on the Bosphorus Strait and encompassing the natural harbor known as the Golden Horn, in the northwest of the country. It is the cultural and financial center of Turkey, and its strategic location has made it one of the world's most important cities for centuries. The city has a population of over 15 million people, making it the second-largest city in Europe by population, and the 16th-largest city in the world. Istanbul is also one of the world's most historic cities, with a rich cultural heritage that spans more than 2,000 years. Istanbul has a rich history, having been the capital of the Eastern Roman Empire, the Byzantine Empire, and the Ottoman Empire. It was also the capital of the Turkish Republic between 1923 and 1933. The city is home to numerous historic landmarks, including the Hagia Sophia, the Blue Mosque, and the Topkapi Palace. Istanbul is a major economic center, with a diverse range of industries including finance, tourism, and manufacturing. The city is home to the Istanbul Stock Exchange, and is also a hub for international trade. The city is known for its vibrant culture, with a rich tradition of music, art, and literature. Istanbul is also famous for its cuisine, which blends traditional Turkish flavors with influences from the Mediterranean and the Middle East. Despite its many strengths, Istanbul faces a number of challenges, including traffic congestion, air pollution, and urbanization. The city is also vulnerable to natural disasters, including earthquakes and floods.

Rio de Janeiro.passage: Rio de Janeiro, commonly referred to simply as Rio, is the second-largest city in Brazil, with a population of approximately 6.6 million people as of 2019. It is the capital and largest city of the state of Rio de Janeiro, and is located within the greater Rio de Janeiro metropolitan area. Rio de Janeiro is famous for its beautiful natural settings, including its beaches, forests, and mountains, as well as its vibrant culture and history. The city is known around the world for its annual Carnival celebration, which is considered the largest carnival in the world, and draws millions of visitors from around the globe each year. Rio de Janeiro has a diverse economy, with a focus on tourism, finance, and industry. The city is home to several major companies, including Petrobras, the largest energy company in Brazil, and Vale, one of the world's largest mining companies. Rio de Janeiro is also home to several major universities, including the Federal University of Rio de Janeiro and the Pontifical Catholic University of Rio de Janeiro. NASDAQ.passage: NASDAQ (National Association of Securities Dealers Automated Quotations) is an American stock exchange. It is the second-largest stock exchange in the world by market capitalization, behind only the New York Stock Exchange. NASDAQ was founded in 1971 and is headquartered in New York City. The exchange is home to a number of well-known technology companies, including Apple, Microsoft, and Amazon. NASDAQ is known for its electronic trading platform, which allows investors to buy and sell securities in real-time. The exchange also offers a range of other services, including listings, trading, and market data. Central Park.passage: Central Park is an urban park in Manhattan, New York City. It is located in the borough of Manhattan and covers 843 acres between 59th Street and 110th Street. The park was established in 1858 on land that was originally owned by John Jacob Astor and his wife, and it was designed by Frederick Law Olmsted and Calvert Vaux. Central Park is one of the most visited tourist attractions in New York City, with over 40 million visitors annually. The park is home to several landmarks, including the Central Park Zoo, the Central Park Conservatory Garden, and the Bethesda Fountain. It also features several lakes, ponds, and streams, as well as several walking and biking paths. the New York Stock Exchange.passage: The New York Stock Exchange (NYSE) is an American stock exchange located in New York City, New York. It is the world's largest stock exchange by market capitalization of its listed companies at US$30.1 trillion as of June 2021. The average daily trading value was approximately US$223 billion in 2020. The NYSE trading floor is located at 11 Wall Street and is composed of 21 rooms used for the facilitation of trading. the Yangtze River.passage: The Yangtze River, also known as Cháng Jiāng in Chinese, is the longest river in Asia and the third-longest in the world, after the Nile in Africa and the Amazon in South America. It is the longest river in China and the river flows for 6,300 km (3,915 mi) from the glaciers on the Qinghai-Tibet Plateau in western China eastward across the plains of Sichuan and Hubei provinces, through the hills of southern Anhui and northern Zhejiang provinces, and then into the East China Sea at Shanghai. The river drains one-fifth of the land area of China and its basin is home to one-third of the country's population. The Yangtze River is a major transport artery, with the largest river port in the world, Shanghai, located at its mouth. The river is also a major source of hydroelectric power, with several large dams built along its length. The Yangtze River is home to several endemic and endangered species, including the Chinese alligator, the Yangtze finless porpoise, and the Chinese sturgeon.

East India Company.passage: The East India Company (EIC), also known as the Honourable East India Company (HEIC) or the British East India Company, was an English and later British joint-stock company that was formed to trade with the Indian subcontinent and East Asia. The company was granted a Royal Charter on 31 December 1600, and was officially incorporated on 14 January 1601. The company traded in spices, silk, tea, and cotton, and also had a significant presence in the opium trade. The company's military power allowed it to gain control over large parts of India, establishing the British Raj. the Forbidden City.passage: The Forbidden City is a palace complex in Beijing, China. It was the imperial palace during the Ming and Qing dynasties. The Forbidden City served as the home of the Emperor and his household, as well as the ceremonial and political center of Chinese government. It is located in the center of Beijing, and covers an area of 720,000 square meters. The Forbidden City was declared a World Heritage Site in 1987, and is now one of the most popular tourist attractions in China. The complex consists of 980 buildings, and is surrounded by a moat and a wall. The Forbidden City was built between 1406 and 1420, and underwent several renovations and expansions during the Ming and Qing dynasties. It was named the Forbidden City because it was off-limits to the general public for centuries, and only the Emperor, his family, and selected officials were allowed to enter. Today, the Forbidden City is open to the public, and is a popular destination for tourists and history enthusiasts.

Petrobras.passage: Petrobras, short for Petróleo Brasileiro S.A., is a Brazilian multinational corporation in the petroleum industry, headquartered in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil. Vale.passage: Vale is a Brazilian multinational corporation engaged in metals and mining, and one of the largest logistics operators in Brazil. It is the largest producer of iron ore and nickel in the world. The company also produces manganese, ferroalloys, copper, aluminum, coal, and cobalt.
